questions.question: Define a determiner. (Variant 51)
questions.answer: A word placed before a noun to limit its meaning.

questions.question: Give two examples of prepositions. (Variant 52)
questions.answer: On, under, beside, above, in.

questions.question: What is an infinitive? (Variant 53)
questions.answer: The base verb with 'to', used as a noun or action.

questions.question: Why are homophones confusing? (Variant 54)
questions.answer: They sound alike but have different meanings.

questions.question: How do modals show ability? (Variant 55)
questions.answer: Modals like can/could express what someone is able to do.

questions.question: Why is tense important? (Variant 56)
questions.answer: It shows when an action happens.

questions.question: What do conjunctions connect? (Variant 57)
questions.answer: Words like and/because link ideas or sentences.

questions.question: Why use adjectives? (Variant 58)
questions.answer: To describe nouns and add detail.

questions.question: What is a pronoun? (Variant 59)
questions.answer: A word replacing a noun such as he, she, it.

questions.question: Give one example of degree of comparison. (Variant 60)
questions.answer: Tall, taller, tallest show increasing degree.

questions.question: Explain how determiners, adjectives and nouns work together in sentences. (Insight 151)
questions.answer: Determiners narrow meaning, adjectives colour the noun and nouns name the object, helping build complete ideas.

questions.question: Describe the purpose of modal verbs with examples. (Insight 152)
questions.answer: Modals add meanings like ability, permission or necessity—e.g., students can learn languages or must study rules.

questions.question: How can students master homophones effectively? (Insight 153)
questions.answer: By reading, practising usage and memorising meaning pairs, confusion reduces.

questions.question: Why do grammar rules support clear communication? (Insight 154)
questions.answer: Grammar gives structure so ideas are shared accurately and understood everywhere.

questions.question: Discuss the role of tenses in storytelling and conversation. (Insight 155)
questions.answer: Tenses place events in time and allow speakers to share past, present or future clearly.
